content_blocks.content: یه متن الکی برای محتوای درباره ما

یه متن الکی برای محتوای آژانس خلاقیت وب سن یکی از معتبر ترین و موفق ترین شرکت های فعال در زمینه طراحی سایت و سئو در ایران است. این افتخار حاصل تلاش تیم خلاق و متعهد وب سن و همچنین اعتماد مشتریان عزیزمان بوده است. ما سرسخت هستیم، ما منظم هستیم ، ما خلاق هستیم!
Varagon was created to be a long-term provider of capital to the middle market

Varagon meets borrower demand for flexible, reliable lenders that can deliver across economic cycles. We offer complete, ‘one-stop’ financing solutions and are a preferred lender to leading private equity firms. Our loans are funded by capital commitments from long-term institutional investors.

Varagon is exclusively focused on the middle market and has lent over $14.5 billion since inception.

borrowers.title:
Flexible financing from a
relationship lender that can
grow with your business
borrowers.subtitle: borrowers & Private Equity

first_section_blocks.content: Versatile financing solutions for the middle market

Varagon serves leading middle market companies and private equity firms. We build lasting relationships as a reliable financing partner that supports growing businesses.

We offer competitive products across the debt capital structure, primarily serving borrowers with $10 million to $75 million of EBITDA.

Our team is deeply experienced and we lend to businesses in a diverse range of industries. Our hold sizes and capital markets capabilities allow us to provide total debt solutions with certainty of close.

borrowers.second_section_left_third_line:
Up to $400M hold size enables us to
deliver total financing solutions

second_section_blocks.content: Varagon and Ares Capital Corporation have partnered to deliver market-leading hold sizes and seamless execution in unitranche lending.

third_section_blocks.content:
We are a value-added partner to private equity with a track record of delivering flexible financing and reliable execution across multiple transactions.

We are committed to supporting a firm's objectives over the complete lifecycle of an investment, including facilitating organic growth, financing acquisitions, and completing recapitalizations.
Experienced team of middle market professionals

Each member of our coverage team has spent their entire careers in the middle market. We have deep experience structuring, underwriting, and managing investments in a range of industries, as well as the resources to deliver efficient commitments and timely execution.

borrowers.fourth_section_subtitle: Varagon serves borrowers in a diverse range of industries. Healthcare companies are served by a dedicated team of experts
borrowers.fourth_section_first_block_description: Our General Industries team has expertise structuring, understanding and managing investments in industries across the broader economy.
borrowers.fourth_section_second_block_description: Our Healthcare team brings industry relationships, sector perspective, and transaction knowledge to each opportunity we evaluate. Our expertise allows us to consider opportunities that carry elements of reimbursement risk.

investors.title:
Built to deliver a better
way to invest in middle
market credit
investors.subtitle: Investors

content.content: Direct access to loans sourced by a leading middle market lender

We believe the best way to invest in middle market credit is as a lead lender. Lead lenders see opportunities first and benefit from enhanced diligence, greater control, and an active role in structuring transactions.

Only a select group of lenders have the relationships, capabilities, and credibility to be a ‘first-call’ partner to leading private equity firms. We have invested to build a platform that consistently delivers these opportunities to our investors
Disciplined underwriting by a team of seasoned professionals

We are committed to protecting and growing our investors’ capital. Our team has decades of investment experience and applies a rigorous buy-side underwriting approach to every opportunity we consider.

Each investment undergoes a multi-step underwriting process that begins with a thematic view of industry fundamentals and market conditions. Opportunities are screened by senior credit officers and, if pursued, analyzed by a team of professionals. Finally, our Investment Committee thoroughly reviews each opportunity to identify the investments that deliver the most compelling risk-adjusted returns.
We offer flexible investment solutions with deep transparency, not one-size-fits all products
Market-leading unitranche partnership with Ares Capital
Varagon has partnered with Ares Capital Corporation to create the Senior Direct Lending Program, a joint venture that combines the strength of both firms in unitranche lending.
Products tailored to meet the needs of every investor we serve

Middle market credit appeals to many investors, but Varagon recognizes that each has unique needs, priorities, and investment preferences. Accordingly, we offer a wide range of products to accommodate different investors, as well as customized strategies tailored to specific needs.

We have special expertise working with insurers and offer products designed to optimize capital efficiency and meet other requirements of these investors.
A manager grounded in transparency, alignment, and service

Our commitment to service and transparency applies to every investor we serve. We believe that all investors should have access to clear, useful information about our strategies and their portfolio.

We were built on a core principle of alignment that ties our success to the results we deliver to investors.

investors.testimonial_blockquote: “Varagon was built with a long-term perspective of the direct lending market. We believe that to be successful, we must go beyond originating attractive investments. We must also provide investors with the transparency, service, and flexibility of an in-house investment team.”

members.description: Walter Owens is the Chief Executive Officer of Varagon and a member of its Board of Directors. He is also a member of the firm’s Investment Committee. Walter has deep experience in all aspects of middle market leveraged finance and has led multiple successful lending and asset management businesses over his 35-year career.  Prior to Varagon, he held senior leadership roles at GE Capital, CIT, and TD Bank Group. He holds a B.S. from Villanova University and an M.B.A. from New York University’s Stern School of Business.

members.position: Head of Product Strategy & Corporate Development
members.description: Brett Shapiro is a Partner of Varagon on the Product Strategy & Corporate Development team. Brett joined Varagon from Oak Hill Capital Partners, where he was responsible for evaluating, executing, and managing private equity investments. He began his career in the Financial Institutions Group at UBS Investment Bank, where he provided strategic advisory services to bank, specialty finance, asset management, and financial technology clients. He earned an A.B. degree from Princeton University with a certificate from the Bendheim Center for Finance.

Charlie Riceman is a Partner of Varagon and leads its Sponsor Coverage team. He is also a member of the firm’s Investment Committee. Charlie has spent his career originating, structuring, underwriting, and executing financings in support of middle market private equity clients and has over 20 years of leveraged lending experience across a variety of industries. Prior to joining Varagon, he was Managing Director at Golub Capital. He earned a B.S. degree from Villanova University and an M.B.A. from The Fuqua School of Business at Duke University.

Jeff Schumacher is a Partner of Varagon and leads the firm’s Capital Markets team. Jeff has over 25 years of experience in middle market leveraged finance and capital markets, and has spent his career originating, structuring, underwriting and syndicating transactions in support of private equity clients. Prior to joining Varagon, Jeff was a Managing Director and Group Head of Capital Markets for American Capital (ACAS). He has also held positions in the Leveraged Lending and Capital Markets groups of The Royal Bank of Scotland, The Royal Bank of Canada, and Heller Financial. He earned a B.A. degree from Hofstra University and an M.B.A. from Fordham University.

James Ungari is Varagon’s Chief Risk Officer.  He is also a member of the firm’s Investment Committee. Mr. Ungari has 40 years of investing experience across numerous industries, with a focus on lending in a variety of structures, including first and second liens, unitranche, mezzanine, structured equity and BSL (par, stressed, and distressed). Prior to joining Varagon, he was the Chief Risk Officer of GE Capital Americas, where he concentrated on building the underwriting and asset management platform for commercial finance opportunities. Previously, he held a variety of senior positions at GE Capital. He holds a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting from Illinois State University.

Kevin Marchetti is a Partner of Varagon and leads the firm’s Underwriting & Portfolio Management team. Kevin has extensive experience in risk management and middle market leveraged finance across a range of industries and strategies. Prior to joining Varagon, he was a Senior Vice President at GE Antares Capital.  He has also held senior risk positions at CIT Group and TD Bank. He earned a B.A. degree from Springfield College and an M.B.A. from The University of North Carolina at Charlotte.

Steve Warden is a Partner of Varagon and leads its activities in the Healthcare industry.  He is also a member of the firm’s Investment Committee. Steve brings deep expertise in Healthcare and over 30 years of leveraged finance experience to Varagon. Prior to joining Varagon, he was President and Co-Founder of CIT Healthcare, which he developed into a market-leading leveraged finance franchise with a top 3 lead arranger position. He holds a B.A. degree from St. Lawrence University.

Alice Wong is a Managing Director of Varagon and a member of the firm’s Product Strategy & Corporate Development team. Alice has wide-ranging experience in Financial Services and has executed numerous advisory and financing transactions for bank, insurance, specialty finance and financial technology clients. She joined Varagon from UBS Investment Bank, where she held positions in investment banking and management. Prior to UBS, she was an investment banker in the Financial Institutions Groups of Credit Suisse and Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette. Alice earned a B.S. degree from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.

Brian Carroll is a Managing Director at Varagon and oversees the firm’s Healthcare Underwriting & Portfolio Management team. Brian has extensive experience in underwriting and structuring healthcare leverage finance transactions. Prior to joining Varagon, he was a Managing Director at Golub Capital where he managed the healthcare underwriting team. He has also held senior risk positions within healthcare finance groups at CapitalSource and GE Capital. He earned a B.S. degree from the University of Illinois and an M.B.A. from Northwestern Kellogg School of Management.

Keith Carter is a Managing Director of Varagon with responsibility for originating and structuring transactions for middle market private equity firms in the General Industries sector. Prior to joining Varagon, Keith originated and underwrote middle market leveraged finance transactions at TPG Specialty Lending and at Tennenbaum Capital Partners. He was also a Managing Director at Plainfield Asset Management and an Associate at Heartland Industrial Partners. He began his career in leverage finance at Bankers Trust. He earned a B.A. degree from St. Lawrence University and an M.B.A. from Columbia Graduate School of Business.

Matt Cutri is a Managing Director of Varagon with responsibility for originating and structuring transactions for middle market private equity firms in the General Industries sector. Prior to joining Varagon, Matt held senior origination roles at Antares Capital, GE Antares, and GE Capital. He was also a Senior Vice President at TD Bank and FirstLight Financial, where he focused on middle market sponsored transactions. He earned a B.A. degree from Clarkson University and is a graduate of GE Capital’s Financial Management Program.

Michael Broderick is a Managing Director of Varagon with responsibility for originating and structuring transactions for middle market private equity firms in the Healthcare sector. Prior to joining Varagon, Michael originated debt, equity co-investments and banking opportunities with Capital One’s private equity clients. He also previously oversaw the healthcare sponsor finance team for CapitalSource. He began his career at GE Capital where he held various positions within the healthcare and sponsor finance teams. He earned a B.A. degree from College of the Holy Cross and an M.B.A. from Northwestern’s Kellogg School of Management.

Sam Kwon is a Managing Director of Varagon with responsibility for originating and structuring transactions for middle market private equity firms in the General Industries sector. Sam has spent his career executing private debt transactions in support of middle market private equity firms and has investment experience in a variety of industries. Prior to Varagon, Sam was a Managing Director in American Capital’s Sponsor Finance group. He was also a Principal in the Private Credit group at The Carlyle Group and a Senior Associate at Lightyear Capital. Sam began his career in M&A at UBS Investment Bank. He earned a B.B.A. degree from Emory University.

Terry Robinson is a Managing Director of Varagon and a member of the firm’s Underwriting & Portfolio Management team. Terry joined Varagon from GE Antares Capital where he was responsible for structuring, underwriting, and managing credit investments in a range of industries. He began his career in the Healthcare investment banking group at Bank of America Merrill Lynch, where he advised on M&A and corporate finance transactions for a variety of public and private Healthcare clients. He earned a B.B.A. degree in Finance & Economics from the University of Notre Dame and an M.B.A. from New York University’s Stern School of Business.

Zeshan Ashfaque is a Managing Director of Varagon and a Senior Credit Officer in the Underwriting & Portfolio Management group. Zeshan has extensive experience investing in middle market credit and has originated, executed, and managed investments across a variety of structures, industries, and strategies, including stressed and distressed. Prior to Varagon, he worked in credit investing at Highbridge Principal Strategies, TPG Special Situations Partners, and Goldman Sachs Special Situations Group. He earned a B.B.A. degree from Emory University and an M.S. from The University of Virginia.

Anne Dorsey is a Principal of Varagon and a member of the firm’s Underwriting & Portfolio Management group. Anne has extensive experience in portfolio management, valuation, analytics and credit policy.  Prior to joining Varagon, Anne held senior roles in valuation, credit and portfolio management functions at GE Capital, including most recently as Head of Valuations for GE Capital.  She has served in multiple roles at both GE Capital Commercial Finance and GE Equity.  She was also a Vice President for Originations at Fuji Bank and Vice President of Specialized Lending at Shawmut Bank. She earned an A.B. degree from Smith College.

Bradley Patton is a Principal of Varagon and a member of the firm’s Capital Markets team. Bradley joined Varagon from American Capital’s debt capital markets and syndications team, where he was responsible for structuring, arranging, and syndicating private equity-backed middle market leveraged loan transactions. He also worked in leveraged finance and syndications at BMO Capital Markets and in underwriting for Bank of America’s middle market corporate finance group. He earned a B.B.A. degree from the University of Missouri-Kansas City.

Brian Dossie is a Principal of Varagon and a member of the firm’s Capital Markets team. Brian has over 25 years of experience in capital markets and corporate lending, and has spent his career originating, structuring, underwriting and syndicating transactions in support of clients. Prior to joining Varagon, Brian was a Director at HSBC Securities leading capital markets for middle market companies. He has also held positions in the Leveraged Finance and Capital Markets groups of Lehman Brothers, Merrill Lynch and Fleet Securities. He earned a B.S. degree from Boston College and an M.B.A. from Fordham University.

Jason Weiskopf is a Principal of Varagon with responsibility for originating and structuring transactions for middle market private equity firms in the General Industries sector. Jason joined Varagon from the Corporate & Asset Finance Lending Group at Macquarie, where he analyzed and structured middle market credit investments across the capital structure. He also worked at Citi Credit Opportunities, a principal investing group within Citigroup, where he underwrote first-lien, unitranche, second-lien, and mezzanine middle market debt transactions. He earned a B.S. in Engineering Science & Mechanics from Virginia Tech.

Mike Blumberg is a Principal of Varagon and a member of the firm’s Underwriting & Portfolio Management team. Mike joined Varagon from Antares Capital, where he was responsible for underwriting, structuring, and managing credit investments in a range of industries. Prior to Antares, he worked at HighPoint Capital, where he underwrote and managed senior debt, junior debt, and equity investments. He also worked at Canaccord Adams, where he focused on M&A transactions and private and public equity offerings. He earned an A.B. from Harvard College.

Noelle Barcenas is a Principal of Varagon and a member of the firm’s Investor Relations team. Prior to joining Varagon, Noelle was a Vice President in the Investor Relations group at H.I.G. Capital. Previously, she was a Senior Associate at Providence Equity / Benefit Street Partners. She began her career at Deloitte & Touche. She earned a B.S. in Accounting from University of Southern California and an M.B.A. from The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.

Alex Beygelman is a Vice President of Varagon and a member of the firm’s Product Strategy & Corporate Development team. Alex joined Varagon from Barclays Investment Bank, where he specialized in strategic advice and capital raising for specialty finance, asset management and financial technology clients within their Financial Institutions Group. He earned a B.B.A. degree in Finance & Investments from the Baruch College Zicklin School of Business.

Alex Cereste is a Vice President of Varagon and a member of the firm’s Underwriting & Portfolio Management team. Alex joined Varagon from Rothschild, where he was an Associate in the Restructuring & Debt Advisory group. He began his career as a distressed debt analyst with a hedge fund that focused on in-court restructurings. He earned a B.A. from Seton Hall University, M.S. in Accounting from Wake Forest University, is a Chartered Financial Analyst and Certified Public Accountant.

Amit Vyas is a Vice President of Varagon and a member of the firm’s Underwriting & Portfolio Management team focused on Healthcare. Prior to joining Varagon, Amit was at Capital One Healthcare where he was responsible for underwriting, structuring and managing credit investments in healthcare.  He began his career at GE Capital as a credit analyst and worked in mergers and acquisitions. A majority of his tenure at GE Capital was with the Healthcare Cashflow team focused on underwriting middle market healthcare transactions. He earned a B.S. in Finance with a minor in Accounting from DePaul University.

Andrew Witkowski is a Vice President of Varagon and a member of the firm’s Underwriting & Portfolio Management team. Andrew joined Varagon from Lone Star Funds, where he was responsible for evaluating, structuring, underwriting and managing credit and equity investments across a range of industries. He began his career at JP Morgan. Andrew earned a B.A. from Hamilton College.

Bennett Kenyon is a Vice President of Varagon and a member of the firm’s Capital Markets team. Bennett joined Varagon from CIT, where he was responsible for evaluating, structuring, underwriting and managing middle market credit investments across a range of industries. Bennett earned a B.S. from Cornell University and is a Chartered Financial Analyst.

Deborah Reich is a Vice President of Varagon and a member of the firm’s Investor Relations team. Deborah joined Varagon from York Capital Management, where she was a member of the Client Advisory Group. She began her career at Goldman Sachs in the Principal Strategic Investments group. She holds a B.S. degree from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.

Derek Sacco is a Vice President of Varagon and a member of the firm’s Underwriting & Portfolio Management team. Derek joined Varagon from TPG Special Situations Partners, where he was responsible for underwriting and monitoring first lien, second lien, and junior capital investments in performing, stressed and distressed companies across industries. Derek began his career at Prudential Capital Group, where he focused on originating, underwriting and monitoring senior debt, mezzanine debt, and private equity investments in middle market companies. He earned a B.S. in Management from Boston College.

Evan Seidenberg is a Vice President of Varagon and a member of the firm’s Underwriting & Portfolio Management team focused on Healthcare. Evan joined Varagon from KCAP Financial, where he was a Senior Credit Analyst responsible for underwriting and monitoring first lien, second lien and junior capital investments. Previously, Evan was an Assistant Vice President at CIT focused on underwriting middle-market healthcare transactions. He holds a B.B.A. from the University of Michigan’s Ross School of Business.

Jason Wang is a Vice President of Varagon and a member of the firm’s Underwriting & Portfolio Management team. Jason joined Varagon from American Capital, where he was responsible for evaluating, structuring, underwriting and managing credit and equity investments across a range of industries. He began his career in Esoteric Structured Products and RMBS at Barclays Investment Bank. He earned a B.S. in Economics from Duke University.

Jonathan Ko is a Vice President of Varagon and a member of the firm’s Product Strategy & Corporate Development team. Jonathan joined Varagon from Golub Capital, where he was responsible for new product development, existing product management, M&A and other key strategic initiatives. Prior to Golub, he worked in the Corporate Strategy group at Springleaf Financial and was an investment banker in the Financial Institutions Group at Bank of America Merrill Lynch. He earned a B.S. degree in economics from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.

Matthew Giller is a Vice President of Varagon and a member of the firm’s Underwriting & Portfolio Management team. Matthew joined Varagon from Goldman Sachs, where he was a Vice President in the BDC & Credit Alternatives group. He began his career as an Analyst at Goldman Sachs focusing on evaluating and monitoring private and public credit investments. He earned a B.B.A. in Finance and B.A. in Economics from Queens College, and is a Chartered Financial Analyst.

Michael Barrasso is a Vice President of Varagon and a member of the firm’s Underwriting & Portfolio Management team. Michael joined Varagon from Antares Capital, where he was responsible for evaluating, structuring, underwriting, documentation and portfolio management of middle-market transactions across a range of industries. He began his career in the Financial Management Program at GE Capital. He earned a B.S. in Economics from The John Hopkins University.

Robby Bourgeois is a Managing Director of Varagon and leads its Finance & Operations team. He is also the firm’s Chief Compliance Officer. Robby joined Varagon from TPG Special Situations Partners (TSSP), the credit investing platform of TPG. Robby held multiple roles at TSSP, most recently serving as Vice President & Controller over its $8 billion of actively-managed credit funds. He also managed the accounting and operations of TPG Specialty Lending, a publicly-traded business development company. Prior to TSSP, Robby was responsible for the accounting and back office operations for private equity funds of TPG Capital. Robby began his career at Ernst & Young in the Assurance & Advisory practices. He earned a B.B.A. in Accounting & Finance from Texas Christian University.

Afsar Farman-Farmaian is a Managing Director, Associate General Counsel, and Senior Compliance Officer of Varagon. Afsar joined Varagon from AIG Investments, where she had senior responsibility for the structuring, legal and regulatory aspects of investment strategies. She previously held senior legal and investment roles at PineBridge Investments. She began her career at Cleary, Gottlieb, Steen & Hamilton LLP. She earned an A.B. degree from Princeton University and a J.D. from Harvard Law School.

Kevin Hah is a Principal of Varagon and a member of the Finance and Operations team. Kevin joined Varagon from Medley Management Inc., where he was a Managing Director of Finance and led teams responsible for accounting, financial reporting and operations for its business development company, private equity funds and separately managed accounts. Prior to joining Medley, Kevin held positions at both Vantium Management, LP as Chief Financial Officer and GSC Group, Inc. as Controller. He began his career at Rothstein, Kass & Company, P.C. in the Auditing and Accounting practices. Kevin is a CPA and earned his B.B.A. in Accounting from the University of Oklahoma and his M.B.A. from the Oklahoma City University.

Jennifer Mashburn is a Principal of Varagon and a member of the Finance & Operations team. Jennifer joined Varagon from SandsPoint Capital Advisors, where she was a Vice President of Investment Accounting and led a team responsible for cash management and financial reporting for its real estate funds. Prior to SandsPoint, Jennifer worked for the financial reporting function of Oak Hill Capital Management. She began her career in real estate accounting at Greystar Management Services and Blue Star Investments. Jennifer is a CPA and earned her B.S. in Accounting from the University of Texas at Arlington and her M.S. in Accounting from the University of Texas at Dallas.

Jessica Rio is a Marketing Manager of Varagon. Jessica joined Varagon from Antares Capital, where she was responsible for commercial excellence analytics, sales force effectiveness metrics and other marketing initiatives. Prior to Antares, Jessica worked for the Sponsor Finance business at GE Capital. She began her career working in GE’s Corporate Financial Services division of GE Capital. She earned a B.S. in Business and Technology from the University of Connecticut and an M.B.A. from Fairfield University.

section.title: No Offer
section.content:
The information, tools and material presented in this Website are provided to you for informational purposes only and are not intended to be, and should not be used or considered as an offer, recommendation or a solicitation to sell or an offer, recommendation or solicitation to buy or subscribe to any financial instruments, investment management services or advisory services. It is the user’s responsibility to evaluate the accuracy, completeness and usefulness of any content provided on this Website. Your use of the Website constitutes your acknowledgement that you bear all risks associated with using such content.

This Website does not intend to provide investment, tax or legal advice and Varagon has rendered no advice concerning the legal, regulatory or accounting treatment, or possible tax consequences of any transaction described herein. Varagon does not represent that the securities, financial instruments, products or services are suitable or appropriate for all investors or customers. Decisions based on information contained on this Website are the sole responsibility of the user. Prior to the execution of any transaction involving information provided by this Website, the user should consult its business advisor, attorney, and/or tax and accounting advisors with respect to the price, suitability, value or other aspects of any stock, bond, mutual fund, security or other investment. Depending on the user’s specific investment objectives and financial position, the investments discussed on this Website may or may not be suitable. It is up to the user to weigh any investment decision carefully.

section.title: Content Disclaimers
section.content:
We make reasonable efforts to ensure accuracy with respect to the Content (as defined below), but at times we may not promptly update or correct the Website even if we are aware that it is inaccurate, outdated or otherwise inappropriate. Dated information speaks only as of the date indicated, and not as of the date that you may access the information. Varagon does not warrant or guaranty the accuracy or completeness of the information made available on the Website. In addition, Varagon reserves the right, in its sole discretion, without any obligation and without any notice, to change, modify or delete the information, materials and descriptions on this Website and to suspend or deny access to it. Varagon may discontinue or change any product or service described on this Website at any time.

All data included in the Website is as of December 31, 2019, unless otherwise indicated. Amounts identified in the Website as “invested since inception” or “lent since inception” refer to investments originated (or “committed”) on behalf of our investors, co-investment partners, and joint ventures. Committed investments may include both funded and unfunded commitments relative to certain investments. Amounts identified in the Website as the “investment portfolio” refer to current committed investments across our investor and joint venture portfolios.

Past performance should not be taken as an indication or guarantee of future performance, and no representation or warranty, express or implied, is made regarding future performance. Opinions and/or estimates reflect a judgment at the original date of publication by Varagon and are subject to change without notice. The price, value of and income from any of the financial instruments mentioned on this Website may change over time.

This Website may contain, or may be deemed to contain, “forward-looking” statements, which are statements other than statements of historical facts. By their nature, forward-looking statements involve risks and uncertainties because they relate to events and depend on circumstances that may or may not occur. Future projections are subject to numerous risk factors and, accordingly, no forward-looking statements contained herein should be deemed, in any manner whatsoever, to be promises of future performance.

section.title: Third-Party Information and Sites
section.content: Varagon does not guarantee the accuracy or completeness of any information or data from third-party sources. The Website may also contain links to sites owned and operated by other parties. Inclusion of these links and services on the Website does not constitute our endorsement of the materials on those third-party sites and does not signify any affiliation with the owners or operators of those third-party sites and services. Your use of such third-party sites and services is subject to the terms and conditions set by the third-party site or service in question. Varagon is not responsible for and has no control over the privacy policies of those sites. We encourage you to review the privacy policies of those sites prior to providing them with any information.

section.title: Accessing the Website
section.content: If you have been provided with a username and password in order to access certain services and sections of the Website, you are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your username and password, and you agree to accept responsibility for all activities that occur under your username or password. Varagon will not be responsible or liable for any loss, expense or damage arising in any way from the use of the username and password or the accessing of information or materials therewith. You agree to notify Varagon immediately of any loss, theft, disclosure or unauthorized use of your password or any other breach of security.

section.title: Conduct on our Website
section.content:
Varagon does not want to receive, and you are deemed to covenant and agree through the use of the Website not to provide, any information or materials to Varagon that are defamatory, threatening, obscene, harassing, in violation of any law, governmental requirements or otherwise unlawful, or that incorporate the proprietary information or materials of another person or entity.

While accessing or using any portions of the Website, you agree that neither you nor your agents shall do any of the following, including, without limitation, violating or attempting to violate the security of the Website:

  • tamper with any portion of the Website;
  • impersonate any person or entity or misrepresent your affiliation with any other person or entity;
  • conduct fraudulent activities on the Website;
  • obtain or attempt to gain unauthorized access to other computer systems, materials, information or any services available on or through the Website through any means, including through the use of meta tags or other hidden text or by other means not intentionally made publicly available or provided for through the Website;
  • engage in “spidering,” “screen scraping,” “database scraping,” mining or harvesting of e-mail addresses or other personal information, or any other automatic or unauthorized means of accessing, logging-in or registering on any of the Website, or obtaining lists of users or other information from or through the Website, including, without limitation, any information residing on any server or database connected to the Website;
  • interrupt, damage, disable, overburden or impair the Website or interfere with any other party’s use and enjoyment of the Website, such as sending mass unsolicited messages or “flooding” servers with requests;
  • circumvent, reverse engineer, decrypt, or otherwise alter or interfere with (or attempt, encourage or support anyone else’s attempt to do any of the foregoing) the Website or its services or any software on the Website;
  • attempt to probe, scan, or test the vulnerability of the Website or to breach the security or authentication measures without proper authorization;
  • violate, plagiarize or infringe the rights of third parties, including without limitation, copyright, trademark, trade secret, confidentiality, contract, patent, rights of privacy or rights of publicity or any other proprietary or legal right; or
  • remove any notices, warnings, labels, annotations, or instructions from any portion of the Website, including, without limitation, any patent, trademark, copyright, or other proprietary notices or license provisions.

Any violations of these Terms, this Website, system, or network security, including attempts to intentionally access a computer without authorization or exceed your authorized access level, may result in civil and criminal charges. Varagon may investigate occurrences that might involve such violations and may involve, and cooperate with, law enforcement authorities in prosecuting users who are involved in such violations. Varagon may, without prior notice or warning of any kind, restrict or terminate the access of any and all users at any time and for any reason, to all or any portion of the Website, including if, among other things, Varagon concludes in its sole discretion that such restriction or termination is necessary to prevent, or prevent the further spread of, a virus, security breach, or system malfunction.

section.content: All text, images, graphics, sounds, software code and other content (“Content”) on the Website, including the selection and arrangement thereof, are protected under the copyright laws, trademark laws and other intellectual property laws of the United States and other countries and are the property of Varagon or its affiliates or applicable third parties, unless otherwise stated. You may not reproduce, redistribute, publish or otherwise use by electronic or any other means any of the Content without Varagon’s prior written consent.

section.content: Varagon’s name and logos on the Website are a service mark of Varagon Capital Partners, L.P. They may not be used or displayed without the prior written consent of Varagon. All other trademarks, service marks and company names and logos appearing on the Website are the property of their respective owners and their use shall not be construed as an endorsement of Varagon of any kind.

section.title: Visitors from Outside the United States
section.content: The Website and services are offered from the United States. We make no representations or warranties that the Website or services are appropriate or available for use in countries outside of the United States. Visitors who choose to access the Website and services from outside of the United States do so at their own initiative and are responsible for compliance with any and all local laws and regulations that may apply to such access and use. If you use the Website outside of the United States, you consent to having your personal data transferred to and processed in the United States. Access to the Website and the services is prohibited where such access or use violates applicable laws or regulations.

section.title: PRIVACY POLICY
section.content: This section describes our privacy practices with respect to the personal information we connect online in connection with the Website and sets out our obligations and yours with respect to your use of the Website. It applies only to the Website and does not necessarily apply to our off-line collection of information.

section.title: Information Collected and Tracked
section.content:
Varagon may collect and retain two types of information about Website users: (i) personal information that individual visitors voluntarily provide when using the Website or on certain other occasions (such as via forms or in emails); and (ii) tracking data, which from time to time may be automatically collected from every Website visitor.

We may, from time to time, store and archive the information you submit to or through the Website. The information that we gather may include your name, title and address, telephone number, email address or other elements of personal information. In addition, if you contact us, we may keep a record of your correspondence, including any information contained therein. You may decline to provide any personal information, but please realize that you thereby may be unable to access certain services and sections of the Website.

In addition to the information you submit to or through the Website, we also may collect and store data from and about you gathered in the course of your use of the Website. Such tracking data may include, without limitation, information regarding the number and frequency of visits to the Website, the Websites that you access before and after you visit the Website, the software and operating system used to access the Website and your IP address and Internet service provider.

section.title: Use of Cookies
section.content: Varagon or any third-party service provider may use cookies, local shared objects, web beacons and other similar technology (collectively, “Cookies”) in connection with your use of the Website, as may certain other sites that provide content on the Website. Cookies are small pieces of information that a Website transfers to your computer’s hard drive for record-keeping purposes and may have unique identifiers and transmit information about you and how you use the Website. Such information may include your search preferences, your browser type and the date and time of use. If you choose, you can disable some (but not all) Cookies in your device or browser settings, but doing so may affect your ability to use the Website or receive certain third-party services provided through the Website.

section.title: How We Use Your Information
section.content:
The information that you provide to us and that we may collect in the future is used for our business purposes and the purpose for which you provided it only, subject to these Terms, including, without limitation, to respond to your requests or correspondence, to contact you about the Website, to request your input regarding ways in which we might improve the Website and/or to inform you about Varagon’s activities, products and services or those of our affiliates.

Your information, particularly tracking data, may also be analyzed so that we can provide you with useful information and can serve you in the best manner possible through enhanced features and functions on the Website. For example, your information may be used to, without limitation, compile statistical, demographic or aggregated information about visitors to the Website generally, or for load-balancing metrics, and also may be used to create reports on user demographics and the traffic patterns of the Website.

We will not disclose any personal information to third parties, except: (i) to our affiliates, agents, consultants and sub-contractors; (ii) to service providers who assist us in running the Website and our business; (iii) when we believe that such disclosure is required by law; (iv) to enforce these Terms; (v) to protect the rights, property, security or safety of Varagon, Website users or the public; (vi) to respond to an emergency; or (vii) as otherwise stated in these Terms. In addition, we may disclose information to certain third parties if you have requested or authorized the disclosure of such information. We may also share aggregated or de-identified information in our sole discretion.

Information provided to third parties is limited to the information needed to perform their functions. We seek to limit third-party use of information; however, we are not responsible for such third-party use of information.

section.title: Transfer of Information to Third Parties upon a Sale or Change of Control
section.content: We retain the right to transfer or assign your information pursuant to or during negotiation of any merger, purchase, reorganization or other transaction relating to Varagon or our assets, in whole or in part.

section.title: How Your Information Is Protected
section.content: We take reasonable precautions to protect your information from loss, misuse or alteration. You should recognize, however, that there is no such thing as “perfect security” on the Internet, and we cannot guarantee the security of your information. In addition, because Internet communications are unsecure, it is also possible that the information you supply to us or your access of any information via the Website will be intercepted during transmission. We are not liable for any breach of our systems or interception of our transmission, and we hereby fully disclaim, to the fullest extent possible under law, any liability associated with any claim relating to a breach of security, data or information.

section.title: Other Communications
section.content: From time to time, we may email users of the Website information regarding important developments affecting Varagon. We may also email users on occasion regarding the Website. Such emails may be sent to users of the Website even if they have not requested to receive any communication from us.

section.title: Compliance with Laws
section.content: We reserve the right to disclose any information to comply with any law, regulation, decree, judgment, order, subpoena or any other governmental order (“Order”) without any obligation to contest or verify the accuracy of such Order.

section.title: Limitation of Liability
section.content:
UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES SHALL VARAGON, ANY OF ITS AFFILIATES, OR THEIR RESPECTIVE OFFICERS, AGENTS, PARTNERS OR EMPLOYEES BE LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, RESULTING FROM THE USE OR THE INABILITY TO USE THE WEBSITE AND SERVICES; OR RESULTING FROM ANY INFORMATION OR SERVICES OBTAINED OR MESSAGES RECEIVED; OR RESULTING FROM UNAUTHORIZED ACCESS TO OR ALTERATION OF YOUR TRANSMISSIONS OF DATA, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, DAMAGES FOR LOSS OF PROFITS, USE, DATA OR OTHER INTANGIBLES, EVEN IF WE HAVE BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.

Because some jurisdictions do not allow the exclusion or limitation of liability for consequential or incidental damages, in such states liability is limited to the fullest extent permitted by law.

If you are dissatisfied with any portion of the site, or with any of these terms of use, your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue using this site.

section.title: Indemnification
section.content: As a condition to your use of the Website, you agree to indemnify, defend and hold harmless Varagon and its respective, officers, directors, affiliates, partners, members, principals, agents, investors, employees, and third party sources from and against any and all suits, losses, claims, demands, liabilities, damages, costs and expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees) that arise from or relate to: (i) your use of the Website; (ii) your breach of these Terms or any representation, warranty or covenant made by you in these Terms; (iii) your violation of any applicable law, statute, ordinance, regulation or of any third party’s rights; or (iv) claims asserted by third parties which, if proven, would place you in breach of representations, warranties, covenants or other provisions contained in these Terms.

section.content: These Terms will be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York, without regard to any principles of conflicts of law. You agree that any action at law or in equity that arises out of or relates to any use of the Website will be filed only in the state or federal courts located in New York County and you hereby consent and submit to the personal jurisdiction of such courts for the purposes of litigating any such action.

section.content: For more information about Varagon, please contact us at info@varagon.com.

1.title: Varagon Capital Partners Supports  Palladium Equity Partners' Acquisition of Accupac
1.first_paragraph: January 27, 2020 - Varagon Capital Partners (Varagon) today announced it is serving as Administrative Agent, Joint Lead Arranger and Sole Bookrunner on a senior secured credit facility to support the acquisition of Accupac by an affiliate of Palladium Equity Partners, LLC (Palladium).
1.content:
Founded in 1974 and headquartered in Mainland, PA, Accupac is a leading contract manufacturer of complex specialty oral care, lotions, topical care, and other over-the-counter and CPG products for the world’s largest pharmaceutical and consumer products companies.

About Palladium Equity Partners

Palladium is a middle market private equity firm with approximately $3 billion in assets under management. The firm seeks to acquire and grow companies in partnership with founders and experienced management teams by providing capital, strategic guidance and operational oversight. Since its founding in 1997, Palladium has made 34 platform investments and over 135 add-on acquisitions. 

For more information about Palladium Equity Partners, visit www.palladiumequity.com.

About Varagon Capital Partners

Varagon Capital Partners is an asset manager focused on direct lending to middle market companies. Varagon invests across the capital structure and offers flexible financing solutions to meet the needs of borrowers and private equity sponsors. Varagon manages funds and accounts on behalf of institutional investors that seek exposure to high-quality, directly-originated middle market loans. As of December 31, 2019, Varagon had made over $14.5 billion of financing commitments to over 180 companies.

For more information about Varagon, visit www.varagon.com.

Media Contact
Nathaniel Garnick/Amanda Klein
Gasthalter & Co.
(212) 257-4170
Varagon@gasthalter.com

next_post.content:
Founded in 2009 and co-headquartered in Phoenix, AZ and Marquette, MI, Easy Ice provides ice machine rental and related services for more than 25,000 ice makers across 47 states. Easy Ice is the only national platform offering a comprehensive subscription service for commercial ice machines that includes installation, cleaning, preventive maintenance, repairs, backup ice, and peak demand ice. This full-service offering allows Easy Ice’s customers to outsource this mission-critical function and focus on their core operations.

About Freeman Spogli & Co.

Freeman Spogli & Co. is a private equity firm dedicated exclusively to investing in and partnering with management in consumer and distribution companies in the United States. Since its founding in 1983, Freeman Spogli has invested over $4.7 billion in 63 portfolio companies with an aggregate transaction value of over $24 billion, and is currently making investments from FS Equity Partners VIII, L.P. Freeman Spogli has offices in Los Angeles and New York.

For more information about Freeman Spogli, visit www.freemanspogli.com.

About Varagon Capital Partners

Varagon Capital Partners is an asset manager focused on direct lending to middle market companies. Varagon invests across the capital structure and offers flexible financing solutions to meet the needs of borrowers and private equity sponsors. Varagon manages funds and accounts on behalf of institutional investors that seek exposure to high-quality, directly-originated middle market loans. As of December 31, 2019, Varagon had made over $14.5 billion of financing commitments to over 180 companies.

For more information about Varagon, visit www.varagon.com.

more_posts.title: Varagon Capital Partners Supports Kinderhook Industries' Acquisition of Intergulf Corporation
more_posts.first_paragraph: December 22, 2017 - Varagon Capital Partners (Varagon) announced today it is serving as administrative agent and sole lead arranger on a senior secured credit facility to support the purchase of Intergulf Corporation by Kinderhook Industries.
more_posts.content:
Headquartered in Pasadena, TX, Intergulf Corporation provides solutions to its industry partners by repurposing and treating petroleum, petrochemical products and waste through creative and environmentally responsible methods.
About Kinderhook Industries
Kinderhook Industries, LLC is a private investment firm that manages over $2.0 billion of committed capital. We have made in excess of 170 investments and follow-on acquisitions since inception. Kinderhook’s investment philosophy is predicated on matching unique, growth-oriented investment opportunities with exceptional financial expertise and our proprietary network of operating partners. Our focus is on middle market businesses with defensible niche market positioning in the healthcare services, environmental / business services and automotive / light manufacturing sectors. We have a track record of successfully and consistently building industry leaders. In addition, Kinderhook is a licensed Small Business Investment Company (SBIC) with the U.S. Small Business Administration. For more information: please visit: http://www.kinderhook.com.
About Varagon Capital
Varagon is a direct lender that offers a broad suite of financing solutions to middle market companies and financial sponsors. Varagon lends across the capital structure with commitments from institutional investors seeking exposure to quality, middle market loans originated through long-term relationships with financial sponsors.  Since its launch in June 2014, Varagon has originated over $5 billion across more than 90 portfolio companies. For more information about Varagon, visit www.varagon.com.
Contact for Varagon Capital Partners
Varagon Capital
Jessica Rio, 646-603-3312
jrio@varagon.com

more_posts.title: Varagon Capital Partners Supports Brynwood Partners' Acquisition of Cold Spring Brewing Company
more_posts.first_paragraph: August 4, 2017 - Varagon Capital Partners announced today it is serving as administrative agent and lead arranger on a $74 million senior secured credit facility to support the purchase of Cold Spring Brewing Company, Inc. by Brynwood Partners VII L.P.
more_posts.content:
Founded in 1874 and headquartered in Cold Spring, Minnesota, Cold Spring Brewing Company, Inc. is a leading contract manufacturer of ready-to-drink beverages, including energy drinks, craft beer, sparking water, juice, tea, premade alcoholic beverages, and soft drinks.

“Varagon was a great partner for Brynwood Partners on this transaction. They understood our investment thesis and financing needs and operated with poise, professionalism and expediency. We look forward to working with them in the future,” said Ian MacTaggart, President and COO of Brynwood Partners.

“We are proud to support Brynwood Partners in this transaction,” said Keith Carter for Varagon. “We look forward to witnessing and supporting the continued growth Brynwood Partners can help the company achieve as a result of their operational expertise and beverage industry knowledge.”
About Brynwood Partners
Brynwood Partners, founded in 1984 and based in Greenwich, CT, is an operationally-focused private equity firm that makes control investments in North American-based lower middle market companies in the consumer sector. Brynwood Partners currently manages more than $725 million of private equity capital for its limited partners, which include U.S. and international pension funds, fund-of-funds, endowments, high net worth family investment offices and financial institutions.  For more information on Brynwood Partners, please visit www.brynwoodpartners.com.
About Varagon Capital
Varagon is a direct lender that offers a broad suite of financing solutions to middle market companies and financial sponsors. Varagon lends across the capital structure with commitments from institutional investors seeking exposure to quality, middle market loans originated through long-term relationships with financial sponsors.  As of June 30, 2017, Varagon had nearly $4 billion of capital available for investment and over $3 billion of assets under management. For more information about Varagon, visit www.varagon.com.
Contact for Varagon Capital Partners
Varagon Capital
Jessica Rio, 646-603-3312
jrio@varagon.com

more_posts.title: Varagon Capital Partners Supports InTandem Capital Partners' Acquisition of Pediatric home Service
more_posts.first_paragraph: December 20, 2018 - Varagon Capital Partners (Varagon) today announced it is serving as administrative agent, lead arranger and bookrunner on a senior secured credit facility to support the acquisition of Pediatric home Service (PHS) by InTandem Capital Partners.
more_posts.content:
Founded in 1990 and headquartered in Roseville, MN, Pediatric home Service is the largest provider of complex and comprehensive in-home care to medically fragile infants, children and adolescents in the upper Midwest.

“We are excited to support InTandem and the Pediatric home Service management team,” said Steve Warden, Partner at Varagon. “This represents Varagon’s first financing investment with InTandem. We look forward to the continued success and growth of PHS.”

“Varagon demonstrated their healthcare expertise and financing creativity, allowing us to partner with the clinical excellence of Mark Hamman and the PHS team as we build upon their success in Minnesota and new markets”, noted Micah Meisel, Managing Director at InTandem.

About InTandem Capital Partners

InTandem Capital is a private equity firm that invests in and helps accelerate the growth of select healthcare services companies. Its goal is to build excellent businesses of significant value working collaboratively with its management team partners. InTandem is comprised of former business executives and experienced investors, and is uniquely qualified to provide strategic, acquisition and operating expertise to help companies significantly increase their value over time. InTandem provides active support to the management of its portfolio companies directly, and leverages its network of industry executives to augment its capabilities.

For further information about InTandem, visit www.intandemcapital.com.

About Varagon Capital Partners

Varagon is a leading lender to middle market companies and private equity firms. Varagon invests across the capital structure and delivers flexible financing solutions that meet the needs of our private equity partners. Varagon provides investors with exposure to high-quality, directly-originated middle market loans through products designed for sophisticated institutions. Since inception, Varagon has made over $9.0 billion of investment commitments to over 120 middle market companies.

For additional information about Varagon, please visit www.varagon.com.

previous_post.title: Varagon Capital Partners Supports Freeman Spogli & Co.’s  Acquisition of Easy Ice
previous_post.first_paragraph: January 9, 2020 - Varagon Capital Partners (Varagon) today announced it is serving as Administrative Agent and Joint Lead Arranger on a senior secured credit facility to support the acquisition of Easy Ice, LLC (Easy Ice) by Freeman Spogli & Co.
previous_post.content:
Founded in 2009 and co-headquartered in Phoenix, AZ and Marquette, MI, Easy Ice provides ice machine rental and related services for more than 25,000 ice makers across 47 states. Easy Ice is the only national platform offering a comprehensive subscription service for commercial ice machines that includes installation, cleaning, preventive maintenance, repairs, backup ice, and peak demand ice. This full-service offering allows Easy Ice’s customers to outsource this mission-critical function and focus on their core operations.

About Freeman Spogli & Co.

Freeman Spogli & Co. is a private equity firm dedicated exclusively to investing in and partnering with management in consumer and distribution companies in the United States. Since its founding in 1983, Freeman Spogli has invested over $4.7 billion in 63 portfolio companies with an aggregate transaction value of over $24 billion, and is currently making investments from FS Equity Partners VIII, L.P. Freeman Spogli has offices in Los Angeles and New York.

For more information about Freeman Spogli, visit www.freemanspogli.com.

About Varagon Capital Partners

Varagon Capital Partners is an asset manager focused on direct lending to middle market companies. Varagon invests across the capital structure and offers flexible financing solutions to meet the needs of borrowers and private equity sponsors. Varagon manages funds and accounts on behalf of institutional investors that seek exposure to high-quality, directly-originated middle market loans. As of December 31, 2019, Varagon had made over $14.5 billion of financing commitments to over 180 companies.

For more information about Varagon, visit www.varagon.com.

more_posts.title: Varagon Capital Partners Supports Avista Capital Partners’ Acquisition of GCM
more_posts.first_paragraph: September 11, 2019 - Varagon Capital Partners (Varagon) today announced it is serving as administrative agent on a unitranche credit facility to support the acquisition of GCM by Avista Capital Partners. Founded in 1983 and headquartered in Union City, California, GCM is the premier MedTech outsourced precision manufacturer.
more_posts.content:
“We are excited to partner with Avista Capital Partners along with the GCM management team to support their growth initiatives,” said Michael Broderick, Managing Director at Varagon.

“Varagon was a great partner for Avista Capital Partners on this transaction. They understood our financing needs, and operated with professionalism and expediency. We look forward to working with them in the future,” said Rob Girardi, Partner at Avista.

About Avista Capital Partners

Avista Capital Partners is a private equity firm that invests in leading healthcare companies. It focuses on mid-sized companies concentrated in the healthcare sectors like pharmaceuticals, medical devices, outsourced pharmaceutical services, distribution, and consumer-driven healthcare. The firm is headquartered in New York, New York and was founded in 2005.

For more information about Avista, visit www.avistacap.com.

About Varagon Capital Partners

Varagon is a leading lender to middle market companies and private equity firms. Varagon invests across the capital structure and delivers flexible financing solutions that meet the needs of our private equity partners. Varagon provides investors with exposure to high-quality, directly-originated middle market loans through products designed for sophisticated institutions. Since inception, Varagon has made over $11.0 billion of investment commitments to over 140 middle market companies.

For more information about Varagon, visit www.varagon.com.

next_post.title: Varagon Capital Partners Supports Sentinel Capital Partners’ Recapitalization of New Era Technology
next_post.first_paragraph: September 27, 2019 - Varagon Capital Partners (Varagon) today announced it is serving as Administrative Agent on a senior secured credit facility to support the recapitalization of New Era Technology by Sentinel Capital Partners (Sentinel).
next_post.content:
Founded in 2013 and headquartered in West Chester, PA, New Era Technology is a global IT solutions provider that installs and maintains the IT, networking, connectivity and data requirements of companies.

“We are excited to partner with Sentinel in its recapitalization of New Era Technology, said Matthew Cutri, Managing Director for Varagon. We look forward to supporting management and Sentinel as they continue to grow the business.”

About Sentinel Capital Partners

Sentinel specializes in buying and building businesses in the lower midmarket in the United States and Canada in partnership with management. Sentinel targets aerospace and defense, business services, consumer, distribution, food and restaurants, franchising, healthcare, and industrial businesses. Sentinel invests in management buyouts, recapitalizations, corporate divestitures, and going-private transactions of established businesses with EBITDA of up to $65 million. Sentinel also invests in special situations, including balance sheet restructurings and operational turnarounds.

For more information about Sentinel, visit www.sentinelpartners.com.

About Varagon Capital Partners

Varagon is a leading lender to middle market companies and private equity firms. Varagon invests across the capital structure and delivers flexible financing solutions that meet the needs of our private equity partners. Since inception, Varagon has made over $11.0 billion of investment commitments to over 140 middle market companies.

For more information about Varagon, visit www.varagon.com.

next_post.title: Varagon Capital Partners Supports L Squared Capital Partners’ Investment in GWS Tool Group
next_post.first_paragraph: September 19, 2019 - Varagon Capital Partners (Varagon) today announced it is serving as administrative agent on a unitranche credit facility to support the recapitalization of GWS Tool Group (GWS) by L Squared Capital Partners (L Squared).
next_post.content:
Headquartered in Tavares, Florida, GWS Tool Group is a vertically integrated manufacturer of highly engineered custom, standard and modified standard cutting tools, primarily servicing aerospace and defense, power generation, automotive and medical sectors.

 

“We are excited to partner with L Squared along with the GWS management team to support their growth initiatives,” said Sam Kwon, Managing Director at Varagon. “This represents Varagon’s third platform investment with L Squared. We look forward to the continued success and growth of GWS.”

 

“Varagon has proven to be a strategic financing partner for us in getting deals done in this market,” said Randall Hunt, Partner at L Squared. “We’re thrilled to have Varagon involved in GWS as we pursue acquisitive growth and utilize a flexible debt capital facility to help finance accretive add-ons.”

About L Squared Capital Partners

L Squared Capital Partners is an investment firm with offices in Newport Beach, CA, and Chicago, IL, that seeks to make long-term investments in leading growth companies that operate in targeted sectors: Tech-Enabled Services & Software, Industrial Technology & Services, and Education Technology. The firm’s unique investor base of family offices enables it to focus on long-term value creation driven by revenue and earnings growth, not financial engineering or market timing. The principals of L Squared have worked together for over a decade and have over 60 years of combined experience investing in growing private companies.

For more information about L Squared Capital Partners, visit www.lsquaredcap.com.

About Varagon Capital Partners

Varagon is a leading lender to middle market companies and private equity firms. Varagon invests across the capital structure and delivers flexible financing solutions that meet the needs of our private equity partners. Varagon provides investors with exposure to high-quality, directly-originated middle market loans through products designed for sophisticated institutions. Since inception, Varagon has made over $11.0 billion of investment commitments to over 140 middle market companies.

For more information about Varagon, visit www.varagon.com.

more_posts.title: Varagon Capital Partners Supports TPG Growth's Acquisition of Q-Centrix
more_posts.first_paragraph: November 30, 2018 - Varagon Capital Partners (Varagon) today announced it is serving as administrative agent, lead arranger and bookrunner on a senior secured credit facility to support the acquisition of Q-Centrix by TPG Growth. Q-Centrix is the largest registry data management company in the U.S.
more_posts.content:
Founded in 2010 and headquartered in Chicago, IL, Q-Centrix aims to measurably improve the quality and safety of patient care in the U.S. through the use of its market-leading technology platform, Q-Apps, that augments the clinical intelligence and efficiency of the industry’s largest and broadest team of nurse-educated, Quality Information Specialists. Processing in excess of 2 million quality data transactions annually, Q‑Centrix provides quality data capture, surveillance, measure calculations, analysis, reporting, and improvement solutions.

“With Varagon’s expanded healthcare investment team, we are excited to partner with TPG Growth and the Q-Centrix management team to continue delivering a comprehensive quality data management solution to hundreds of hospitals,” said Sam Kwon, Managing Director at Varagon.

About TPG Growth

TPG Growth is the middle market and growth equity investment platform of TPG, the global alternative asset firm. With approximately $13.5 billion of assets under management, TPG Growth targets investments in a broad range of industries and geographies. TPG Growth has the deep sector knowledge, operational resources, and global experience to drive value creation, and help companies reach their full potential. The firm is backed by the resources of TPG, which has more than $94 billion of assets under management.

For more information about TPG Growth, visit www.tpg.com .

About Varagon Capital Partners

﻿Varagon is a leading lender to middle market companies and private equity firms. Varagon invests across the capital structure and delivers flexible financing solutions that meet the needs of our private equity partners. Varagon provides investors with exposure to high-quality, directly-originated middle market loans through products designed for sophisticated institutions. Since inception, Varagon has made over $9.0 billion of investment commitments to over 120 middle market companies.

For additional information about Varagon, please visit www.varagon.com .

more_posts.title: Varagon Capital Partners Supports Norwest Equity Partners' Acquisition of Avtex
more_posts.first_paragraph: February 12, 2018 - Varagon Capital Partners (Varagon) announced today it is serving as administrative agent and lead arranger on a senior secured credit facility to support the purchase of Avtex by Norwest Equity Partners (NEP).
more_posts.content:
Headquartered in Minneapolis, MN, Avtex is a customer experience (CX) focused consulting and technology company that provides design, implementation, and ongoing support of solutions in the CX ecosystem, including contact center and CRM solutions.

“We are excited to partner with Norwest Equity Partners in its acquisition of Avtex,” said Matthew Cutri, Managing Director at Varagon. “The NEP team along with their business services and technology-focused Operating Partner, Kevin Torgerson, bring a tremendous amount of expertise in the sector. We look forward to supporting management and NEP as they continue to grow the business.”

“On behalf of the NEP team, we are pleased to have Varagon support our acquisition of Avtex. The entire Varagon team was reliable, easy to work with, and played an integral role in this transaction,” stated Todd Solow, NEP Partner.

About Norwest Equity Partners

Norwest Equity Partners is a company-centric, middle-market investment firm focused on working directly with portfolio management teams to create unique investment strategies that deliver long-term value. Offering a range of investment solutions through management buyouts, recapitalizations, and growth financings, NEP seeks investment opportunities in growing and profitable companies within the agriculture, business services, consumer, distribution, energy, healthcare, and industrials sectors.

For more information about NEP, visit www.nep.com.

About Varagon Capital Partners

Varagon is a direct lender that offers a broad suite of financing solutions to middle market companies and financial sponsors. Varagon lends across the capital structure with commitments from institutional investors seeking exposure to quality, middle market loans originated through long-term relationships with financial sponsors.

For more information about Varagon, visit www.varagon.com.

Sentinel specializes in buying and building businesses in the lower midmarket in the United States and Canada in partnership with management. more_posts.title: Varagon Capital Partners Supports Marlin Equity Partners' Acquisition of Worksoft
more_posts.first_paragraph: February 25, 2019 - Varagon Capital Partners (Varagon) today announced it is serving as administrative agent on a senior secured credit facility to support the acquisition of Worksoft by Marlin Equity Partners.
more_posts.content:
Headquartered in Dallas, TX, Worksoft is the industry’s leading continuous robotic test automation platform for enterprise packaged applications, offering a diverse ecosystem of service providers, software integrations, and machine learning solutions to enable true end-to-end, unattended automated testing of mission-critical business applications.

“We are excited to partner with Marlin Equity Partners along with the Worksoft management team to support their growth initiatives,” said Sam Kwon, Managing Director at Varagon.

About Marlin Equity Partners

Marlin Equity Partners is a global investment firm with over $6.7 billion of capital under management. The firm is focused on providing corporate parents, shareholders and other stakeholders with tailored solutions that meet their business and liquidity needs. Marlin invests in businesses across multiple industries where its capital base, industry relationships and extensive network of operational resources significantly strengthen a company’s outlook and enhance value. Since its inception, Marlin, through its group of funds and related companies, has successfully completed over 140 acquisitions. The firm is headquartered in Los Angeles, California with an additional office in London.

For more information about Marlin, visit www.marlinequity.com.

About Varagon Capital Partners

Varagon is a leading lender to middle market companies and private equity firms. Varagon invests across the capital structure and delivers flexible financing solutions that meet the needs of our private equity partners. Varagon provides investors with exposure to high-quality, directly-originated middle market loans through products designed for sophisticated institutions. Since inception, Varagon has made over $9.0 billion of investment commitments to over 120 middle market companies.

For additional information about Varagon, please visit www.varagon.com.

previous_post.first_paragraph: September 19, 2019 - Varagon Capital Partners (Varagon) today announced it is serving as administrative agent on a unitranche credit facility to support the recapitalization of GWS Tool Group (GWS) by L Squared Capital Partners (L Squared).
previous_post.content:
Headquartered in Tavares, Florida, GWS Tool Group is a vertically integrated manufacturer of highly engineered custom, standard and modified standard cutting tools, primarily servicing aerospace and defense, power generation, automotive and medical sectors.

 

“We are excited to partner with L Squared along with the GWS management team to support their growth initiatives,” said Sam Kwon, Managing Director at Varagon. “This represents Varagon’s third platform investment with L Squared. We look forward to the continued success and growth of GWS.”

 

“Varagon has proven to be a strategic financing partner for us in getting deals done in this market,” said Randall Hunt, Partner at L Squared. “We’re thrilled to have Varagon involved in GWS as we pursue acquisitive growth and utilize a flexible debt capital facility to help finance accretive add-ons.”

About L Squared Capital Partners

L Squared Capital Partners is an investment firm with offices in Newport Beach, CA, and Chicago, IL, that seeks to make long-term investments in leading growth companies that operate in targeted sectors: Tech-Enabled Services & Software, Industrial Technology & Services, and Education Technology. The firm’s unique investor base of family offices enables it to focus on long-term value creation driven by revenue and earnings growth, not financial engineering or market timing. The principals of L Squared have worked together for over a decade and have over 60 years of combined experience investing in growing private companies.

For more information about L Squared Capital Partners, visit www.lsquaredcap.com.

About Varagon Capital Partners

Varagon is a leading lender to middle market companies and private equity firms. Varagon invests across the capital structure and delivers flexible financing solutions that meet the needs of our private equity partners. Since inception, Varagon has made over $11.0 billion of investment commitments to over 140 middle market companies.

more_posts.title: Varagon Capital Partners Supports  Palladium Equity Partners' Acquisition of Accupac
more_posts.first_paragraph: January 27, 2020 - Varagon Capital Partners (Varagon) today announced it is serving as Administrative Agent, Joint Lead Arranger and Sole Bookrunner on a senior secured credit facility to support the acquisition of Accupac by an affiliate of Palladium Equity Partners, LLC (Palladium).
more_posts.content:
Founded in 1974 and headquartered in Mainland, PA, Accupac is a leading contract manufacturer of complex specialty oral care, lotions, topical care, and other over-the-counter and CPG products for the world’s largest pharmaceutical and consumer products companies.

About Palladium Equity Partners

Palladium is a middle market private equity firm with approximately $3 billion in assets under management. The firm seeks to acquire and grow companies in partnership with founders and experienced management teams by providing capital, strategic guidance and operational oversight. Since its founding in 1997, Palladium has made 34 platform investments and over 135 add-on acquisitions. 

For more information about Palladium Equity Partners, visit www.palladiumequity.com.

About Varagon Capital Partners

Varagon Capital Partners is an asset manager focused on direct lending to middle market companies. Varagon invests across the capital structure and offers flexible financing solutions to meet the needs of borrowers and private equity sponsors. Varagon manages funds and accounts on behalf of institutional investors that seek exposure to high-quality, directly-originated middle market loans. As of December 31, 2019, Varagon had made over $14.5 billion of financing commitments to over 180 companies.

For more information about Varagon, visit www.varagon.com.
